channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Guant√°namo plea deals for accused 9/11 plotters are canceled by federal appeals court
item.description: A federal appeals court has canceled plea deals with three men accused of orchestrating the 9/11 attacks, deepening the legal morass surrounding the l...

item.title: Nigeria says it won't accept U.S. deportees: "We have enough problems of our own"
item.description: Nigeria's government is pushing back against U.S. efforts to send them migrants and foreign prisoners, with Nigerian Foreign Minister Yusuf Tuggar quo...

item.title: Part war propaganda, part comic strip, Bayeux Tapestry to return to U.K.
item.description: On a state visit, France's president announced the loan of the tapestry embroidered with scenes of the 1066 Norman invasion. It will return to the U.K...

item.title: Russia Intensifies Its Air War in Ukraine
item.description: Russia ratcheted up air attacks by drones and missiles on Ukraine this week. The increase comes as President Trump has expressed frustration at Russia...

item.title: Sumy, a center of Ukrainian culture, lives in the crosshairs of a new Russian offensive
item.description: The northern regional capital has become a frequent target of Russian drones, missiles and guided bombs. Now, Ukraine's top general says at least 50,0...

item.title: Trump meets Texas flood victims' families, expressing "anguish of our entire nation"
item.description: President Trump and first lady Melania Trump visited Central Texas Friday to survey the devastation wrought by last week's deadly flooding.

item.title: Trump holds roundtable on deadly Texas floods with first responders and officials
item.description: President Trump and local officials held a news conference Friday in Texas on the floods that have killed more than 120 people. CBS News White House r...

item.title: How US views of immigration have changed since Trump took office, according to Gallup polling
item.description: A Gallup poll shows a substantial jump in the share of Americans who view immigration as positive for the U.S. since President Donald Trump took offic...

item.title: Examining the role of climate change in deadly Texas floods
item.description: Climate change likely played a role in the deadly Texas floods that have killed over 120 people, according to Texas A&M climatologist Jay Banner. CBS ...

item.title: State Department enacts widespread layoffs, cutting 1,353 staff
item.description: The involuntary staff reductions include 1,107 civil service and 246 foreign service employees, according to a notice sent to employees Friday morning...

item.title: Death of Ukrainian conscript prompts row with Hungary
item.description: Allegations that the 45-year-old was beaten with iron bars, weeks after being forcibly conscripted, have been denied by Ukraine's military.

item.title: Trump threatens 35% tariffs on Canadian goods
item.description: Trump has threatened blanket levies of 15% or 20% on most trade partners, and says he will soon announce new tariffs on the EU.

item.title: El Chapo's son pleads guilty to drug trafficking charges in Chicago hearing
item.description: A son of drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman pled guilty in a U.S. drug trafficking case at a hearing in Chicago Friday.

item.title: Watch: Moment child gets stuck inside a claw machine
item.description: The child was rescued unharmed from the toy crane game in the US state of Ohio by first responders.

item.title: Dozens taken to hospital after suspected mass overdose in Baltimore
item.description: At least 27 people have been admitted to hospital, some of whom are in a critical condition.

item.title: Russians tell the BBC how they think the Ukraine war will end
item.description: Russian victory is a key message at the 'Patriotic Festival' a few miles outside Moscow.

item.title: Mourning begins in Texas where more than 170 are still missing from flash floods
Warning sirens helped this small Texas community survive flooding
